results.description:
Welcome!

Converged Infrastructure New York City group (CINYC) is a forum for gaining awareness and exchanging ideas around practical benefits of convergence of business and technology.  Each one of us is, in some way, focused on bridging the gap between business requirements and the properly structured set of technologies to address such requirements.   We are sensitive to the dichotomy that often exists between various groups in large organizations and we are passionate about taking a collaborative approach to closing such gaps.  We are here to learn, to help each other recognize and reap rewards promised by convergence of infrastructure - a relatively new trend focused on lowering the cost of operating cloud environments by engineering and packaging technology stacks.

See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Converged_infrastructure

We exist to help facilitate meetups where professionals & end-users can share best practices for valuing, deploying and operating CI technologies.  Professionals and experts can become aware of new market needs, and new users can gain practical knowledge, expand their foundations about market trends; everyone can grow their professional network. The collaborative cross-organizational approach to implementing CI and harnessing its benefits encourages sharing of ideas, giving rise to sharing best practices - for everyone’s benefit.

Join us if your areas of interest include business transformation, DevOps, use-cases, lessons learned as part of improved organizational re-alignment, as well as intersections of economics and technology.   We expect to have a good mix of technical and business topics and, naturally, welcome speakers and practitioners.
results.name: Converged Infrastructure NYC

results.description:
Circling is the art of presence and co-discovering our deepest selves in community with each other “in the moment”.

 It’s a practice that allows you to enliven, deepen and richen conversations into experiences of profound empathy and insight. 

It’s a practice that naturally has you building skills in connecting, communication, conflict resolution and understanding others. 

It’s a practice that supports the development of genuine curiosity and appreciation for yourself and others. 

What it looks like is a group of people in a circle with their open, curious attention on one individual “getting circled”. Their intention is to “be with” and “understand” what’s happening for this individual moment by moment as “whatever is happening arises”.

The results, in my experience, are profound visceral connection and a quality of conversation that has people moved, inspired and nourished. In my experience, it also results in a much greater awareness of oneself and others. 

This is a meetup group for those interested in developing skills around or experiencing any of what they read above. 

Members can expect to learn the basics of Circling and to participate in two circles every meet up.
results.name: New York Circling Meetup Group

results.description:
As stutterers, we know how tempting it can be to isolate ourselves from the chaos of city life. We know the fear that bubbles up every time we're asked our name, or need help finding an address, ordering food, or even just meeting an old friend. We go to therapy- some of us for years- spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars- trying to free our words. 

Even with every physical skill in the book at our disposal, however,  something's missing.  We're still not convinced we have a right to share, loud and clear, the stories, opinions, and quirks that make us who we are. That's because the key to a full life isn't in the hour-a -week spent in the clinic support group, trying to pour your heart out in the three minutes you have before someone starts getting antsy. Talking about what's going on inside certainly has its place in the therapy process, but lasting change can only come from living loudly- actually going out into the world and communicating, on a regular basis.

That's why I (we ) started NYFS. We're planning on regular ( once a week to two weeks) meetups- some just to hang out, and some structured in such a way that we each face a particular type of communication challenge, with the support of the group behind us. This desensitizes us to the fear of disfluent speech,; the fear of being different.

Examples include:

• Going into a department store and asking where you might find the dinner plates

•  Asking a bus driver for directions as people are getting on ( to help experience time pressure)

•  Placing complicated pizza orders over the phone.

•  Talking to a member of the opposite ( or same) sex that you'd like to get to know better, romantically or otherwise

• Talking to a stranger in the park about what you're doing and what stuttering is exactly ( you'd be surprised at how receptive most people are to it!)

Now, we know that everyone is in a different place with their stuttering. That's why, for the first few weeks, we'll be splitting people into groups based on what they're comfortable with- Easy, Medium, and Difficult challenges. I or another group leader will be available to help talk you through what you're feeling beforehand and to offer support, no matter where you're at.


We ARE NOT  licensed speech pathologists, and don't claim to offer therapy. We just know what de-sensitization has done for us and we hope it can do the same for others, when they're surrounded by friends.


Watch this space, message us with any questions you might have and get ready to be fully you!
results.name: Stutter In the City

results.description:
An Ethics Lab is a discussion and support group that meets weekly on Wednesdays at Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. We are a separate entity and nobody has to join anything to work with us.

We sit around a big wooden table and we talk about what we want to change about ourselves and what we have to do to make that happen. New habits we want to cultivate. Old habits we want to let go of. Beliefs or reactions we have that are harmful to us and other people. Sometimes we discuss ethics or science or religion.

We decide on goals for ourselves and go to the Ethics Lab to report and for support.

Examples:

Mindfulness meditations. Losing weight. Finding a correct lay monastery to join. Developing your critical faculties by use of formal logic and/or mathematics. Overcoming addictions including addictions to emotions or ideas. Gaining weight. Expressing yourself through artwork. Prayer. Joining a group so you can trick yourself into reinventing yourself. Yoga. Finding a boyfriend or girlfriend. Jogging. Changing careers.

Someone pointed out that we are keeping the art of conversation alive. Yep. With a bit of Socratic method, performance art and good old fashioned magic smoke & mirrors mixed in.

Three examples of the kind of thing I might recommend to someone during a talk at the Ethics Lab.

1. Decide on the thing you want to change in yourself and then only commit to observing yourself as it is happening as the very first step.

2. Taking the time to find out what your thoughts and feelings are about your thoughts and feelings.

3. Understanding that meditating can be whatever you are doing at the moment.

An Ethics Lab is a place where people with different even opposing beliefs meet and learn that we are of value to each other because of those differences. It’s a lab because we see being wrong as an opportunity to learn.

I enjoy witnessing people deciding to change then doing it. I also enjoy telling their stories. I’m a writer so I see the Ethics Lab as a mix of everything from poetry to journalism.

I’ve learned so much from the folks who have sat at the table with me since September of last year. Every account of conscious change I can pass on makes it easier for someone, somewhere.
results.name: Ethics Lab of Brooklyn

results.description:
NY novelist Arthur Nersesian  is a prolific novelist with more than  ten novels written in the  last fifteen years.  He is offering for the first time an intensive six week workshop in which he will critique each member's work and share with them the secrets of his successful writing career.  The class will meet once a week and be limited to seven writers who have a work in progress and are serious about getting their work published.

In addition to the workshop, Arthur will give talks based on his own personal experiences regarding:

*Conceiving and plotting a work

*Revising a work upon completion, making it sharper, crisper and better

*The daily discipline of writing (and overcoming blocks)

*How to get your work published, some basic business tips

Anyone interested should submit a fiction writing sample of no more than 3000 words (10 pages) in length. Although his expertise is in the novel form, he will consider short stories, screenplays, and plays. Arthur will then conduct an interview with the most qualified candidates. Payment must be made in advance. Only seven seats are available. Feel free to contact Arthur with any questions.

More about the Author:
Arthur has been published by HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster and Akashic Books. Four of his full-length plays were produced Off-off Broadway, and are now published together as East Village Tetralogy. He wrote the screenplay for one of his books, and last year his third book, Dogrun, was made into a major motion picture, directed by Anthony Edwards, and starring Heather Graham and Gina Gershon. His books have been translated into a half a dozen languages. His short stories, essays, poems and reviews have appeared in various books, magazines and journals.

This is an amazing opportunity to learn in an intimate setting the ins and outs of how to get your work published from someone who has actually done it.
results.name: Intensive Writer Workshop with Real NY Novelist

If you own an adventure bike, BMW GS,KTM 990,1190 Yamaha Super Tenere, Kawasaki KLR ,Triumph Tiger, etc .. Come journey with us as we conquer diverse terrain. From twisties ,gravel,dirt,mud,sand. results.description:
I got hooked on canyoneering while living out west for a few year. When I returned to New York I found a couple of other people doing some really exciting stuff in the Catskills and a few trip reports from across the northeast, but no canyoneering specific websites or organizations.

I started this meetup to fill that need and start building a community of canyoneers across the northeast.

-Andre

What's a typical trip like? A typical trip involves hiking/bushwhacking to the top of a water course and following it down by rappelling waterfalls (some over 100'), down-climbing, lots of slippery boulder hopping, and bushwhacking. Swims are possible, deep wading probably, and there's always lots of getting splashed on.

NEC is not a guide or training service. All trips are member organized and you are solely responsible for your own safety.  

All participants must be, at minimum:

• Strong hikers able to navigate off-trail and bushwhack across difficult terrain (scree, unstable slopes, slippery stream beds, boulder fields, etc) with heavy ropes and gear.

• Experienced rappellers able to negotiate challenging rappels with overhangs, loose rocks, water, slippery footing, etc. Having rappelled once or twice is not "experienced".

• Knowledgeable enough to safety check anchors, rigging, knots and each other. 

What about less experienced members?

You can join the meetup, but cannot come on trip without proper training.

NEC is not a guiding or instructional service and does not provide training, but there are a few other options:

1) The best way to get started is to get trained from a professional instructor in the Zion, Moab, or Los Angeles areas.  Unfortunately there are no instructors on the East Coast. 

2) The second best way is to learn rappelling and anchor building from another sport (technical caving, ice climbing, mountaineering, and rock climbing classes cover the basic skills). Canyoneering techniques are a little different, but the foundation skills are enough to join most trips. 

In time there will an online resource section to supplement formal training with canyoneering-specific techniques and some informal members-hosted skill building practice sessions.
results.name: Northeast Canyoneering

results.description:
Feminism, ah--a word that carries so much baggage. Let's unearth it. Let's talk street harassment. Let's talk gender. Let's talk theory. Let's talk empowerment. Let's talk love. 

People of all sexes and genders and nonsexes and nongenders from Bushwick and beyond are welcome.

What is woman?
Are there things about her that escape the conditioned influences of her character?
How do capitalism and patriarchy make sense of this creature?
Is there freedom for woman in patriarchy?
What is the aim of the street harasser and how can we subvert them?
How can we react to oppression--let alone spot it, declare it for what it is?
How can we recognize the oppressor within ourselves?
How is feminism too often racialized?
Hell, what does that word even mean?

Welcome to The Feminist Salon!
results.name: The Feminist Salon of Bushwick

results.description:
Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies.

Is going into business for you?

If so, enjoy meeting new contacts for networking and be part of the group that brings together a broad range of people thinking about starting a new business. Members include start-up entrepreneurs, experts sharing their knowledge and investors looking for new concepts.

We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars.

This group is intended to be an educational think tank that will help you with the elements of conceiving and starting a new business. Our purpose is to support each other in learning, growing and having fun along the way.

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know! 

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

Organizer: Roger Kuperways, Ph.D. Life long Entrepreneur, investor, and former adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at New York University. 

See us on Facebook and on our parent website http://www.businessonashoestring.com

Comments from past events:

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D

results.description:
We all have an instinctual need for human touch. In this chaotic, individualistic society we live in however, asking for help in fulfilling this most basic, most beautifully human desire has become taboo- a signal of weakness- especially among men. I started this group because I genuinely feel that so many of our ills and traumas could begin to be healed if we allowed ourselves to love and be loved in a completely unselfish, non-sexual way. I hope to host meetups at places like movie theatres, cafes and eventual members' homes, where we sit, hold each other, and talk about whatever might be on our minds. You will learn that it's okay to let other people in, and that it's okay to say no. You'll learn that you are enough and you are loved.
I encourage you, straight or gay, to give this a shot. I know this can change the world, if only we trust in the immense power of physical connection.
results.name: Cuddling Men NYC

The core of yellowchair is its events business: Sandlofer and Goldstein create dinner concepts, match them with the best NYC venues and make seats available via their website,yellowchair.com. For a fixed price, people can access food and drinks that have been expertly curated by yellowchair and their partners, as well as meet like-minded people in a casual dinner setting. It's the perfect experience for food explorers, no-pressure dates and everything in between.

“yellowchair is the ultimate social network for people who love food – and people," says Goldstein.  “Our goal is to create a climate whereby members enrich their social experience with unique, themed food experiences.”

 “Think of it as an innovative version of dinner-with-friends - and new friends," Sandlofer adds. "You don't book a table just for your individual party.  You make a reservation and join other yellowchair members – thereby socializing with like-minded foodies, travelers, tastemakers – and enlarging your circle of acquaintances.”

Friends don't let friends sit in chairs that aren't yellow!

www.yellowchair.com

We promise ...nothing ordinary! And just once per month...at places like
"Rats"; R2L; McCarter and much more...

High Teas and wine tastings...with a twist!  Matinees and Day trips ...  A picnic or two?  Symphony, anyone?

Selected events will be limited to a small group of people.  This will give members the opportunity to really connect and get to know each other.

We want this to be "your" preferred group...so we invite you to participate and help to create a group that's FUN; a group that works for YOU.

BTW... If you would like to know a bit more about membership in this group, please click on the "Pages" section of this site for additional information.

We hope that you'll join us.  See you soon!

results.description:
¿Quiénes somos?
En Spanish Expats nuestro objetivo es reunirnos con españoles y español parlantes que tengan una conexion especial con España. Los eventos que organizamos son informales y no pretenden más que el intercambio de experiencias y opiniones por medio de conversaciones y especialmente ampliar el ambito social de sus miembros a traves de actividades conjuntas.

Hemos buscado en Westchester County grupos parecidos a los de las grandes ciudades pero sin suerte. Claro que no nos importaría bajar a la ciudad para reunirnos con otros españoles pero, ¿por qué no formar un grupo aquí en Westchester donde no tengamos que viajar?

Por eso, hemos decidido a crear nuestro propio grupo convencidos de que hay un gran número de personas que seguro que están interesadas en compartir su tiempo con otros españoles con los cuales tienen algo más que la lengua en común. 

 ¿Quiénes NO somos?
No somos un grupo para practicar el idioma, ya que hay muchos otros meet-ups que ofrecen clases y oportunidades para conversar a diferentes niveles. Nuestros miembros ya hablan un español fluido, si no necesariamente nativo, y se sienten comodos expresandose en castellano.

 ¿Cómo apuntarse?
Sólo hace falta apretar el boton de "Join us" que aparece en la página nuestra de Meet-up. Luego contesta las preguntas completamente. Las preguntas son una manera de conocerse al grupo antes de asistir un evento, y son una herramienta importante para el grupo así que es importante contestarlas completamente. Luego nos llegará tu petición y recibiremos un email para aprobarla. Es posible que no aceptemos aplicaciones que no reflejen los objetivos del grupo.

Pertenecer al grupo es gratis y lo único que se requiere es ser educado y respetuoso con todos, así como cooperar en la organización de los eventos de forma que vuestro RSVP realmente refleje si vais a acudir al evento o no.

Gracias por vuestra participacion y esperamos veros pronto...
results.name: Expats españoles en Westchester County, NY

Workout Details: 

Our workout focuses on functional movements. Some of the things we include are:

Note: When you RSVP we will send you a telephone number you can call/text in case you have any trouble finding us.


What people are saying:

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

Andie - #ThriveInThePark I never thought I would enjoy waking up early on a Saturday, but now I look forward to it, fun workouts with friends that keep you motivated to push yourself!

Dani - #ThriveInThePark I Love everything about it! Such a positive way to bring community together for some weekend activity. The guys/girls that lead the workout and stretches bring such great energy to the group, we basically laugh the whole time - until the lunges and burpees come along, no one laughs at those. 


About our Meetup:

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

http://www.soRipe.com

History:

Thrive in the Park started in 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too will go out into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

results.description: Are you interested in becoming an effective public speaker and improving your listening skills? At $60 for six months it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere. Consider joining Harlem Toastmasters. The club is one of the 14,650 clubs of Toastmasters International. Toastmasters clubs operate in 126 countries. Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Members of Toastmasters improve their speaking skills by attending recurring meetings where they deliver speeches or evaluate other speakers. Membership in Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. How Does It Work? A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a no-pressure atmosphere. There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure.
results.name: Harlem Toastmasters Meetup

results.description:
This is a group of people interested in viewing, collecting, discussing, learning and making Art Jewelry, Custom Jewelry, Fine Jewelry Collections, Silversmithing, Goldsmithing and Metalsmithing. 

Every 3rd Sunday a process demonstration will be conducted in the studio at 2:30pm, this will take place during the Hoboken Gallery Walk.  We can exchange information about various techniques used to make jewelry, silversmithing or goldsmithing.  You are welcome to request a technique or do a demonstration of your own. (please set up in advance)

Meetups will be held in my studio at the Monroe Arts Center, art jewelry galleries, museums and other studios or venues that share interest in art jewelry.  

I would like to share information about the art jewelry community, up and coming events, conferences, openings and competitions happening around our community and outside. I would like to create a dialog about topics that include tools, techniques, processes, materials and why we make what we make.  I think we could learn a lot from each other. 

EatMetal, Inc studio includes a gallery space, workbenches for students, a communal workspace and my own personal work space. I will host open houses, events to preview my new fine jewelry collections, one of a kind pieces and small scale sculpture. Guest jewelry artist's will be invited to come and show their work in the gallery.  All level classes are offered in the fall, winter and spring for an 8 week session. The focus is on core fundamentals and honing your skills. Great fun at the studio is Evening or Afternoon One Day Workshops @ EatMetal, Inc. which center on one project and you get to Bring Your Bling Home!  


Look forward to seeing you in the studio!

Three times a month a surrealist film will be screened in an apartment directly off the 2/3 train. From 515-615; a short or series of shorts will be shown informally as we eat and talk. All feature films will begin promptly at 633pm and guests are asked to stay no later than 1111pm. Snacks will be provided relating to the film, but additional beverages and foods are welcome.

Most films will be followed by an optional discussion and group poetic act. Attendees are encouraged - but not required to - write, paint, draw, sing, slam, rap, rhyme, mime or daydream a response to the movie shown. This group is for any 29+ age careerwomen looking to network and socialize with each other for friendship or casual business networking. We do different ice breaker events, networking and social events at new restaurants, tea houses, wineries, board game nights etc. 

The mission of this group is to enable careerwomen with current, active, ongoing careers to network and socialize with each other in order to educate, emotionally support career women in their careers and in their career-focused lifestyles. It is create a outlet for women to discuss different topics that affect careerwomen every day including individual-specific topics like navigating in your career, overcoming challenges at work, e.g., making alliances with key people in the office-- as well as external factors like the global, national, local business/economy,  the glass ceiling, when will be the first female president.  Whether you are in an ambitious mode or cruising in your job, this is the outlet for you to have a voice about these topics. But do not be fooled - much bantering and jokes are welcome -- we are here to get to know each other.  While networking is encouraged, sales /self marketing is prohibited.

If you are trying to reconnect with new female contacts who are ambitious, intelligent and educated like you, please join us and let's talk shop from female point of view! 

These conversation topics are encouraged: travel, movies, music as well as the intellectual topics like economics, business, finance, even politics and perhaps technology that is ever changing and affecting business.

Founded by local divers and instructors in 1995, the Explorers Dive Club is a nonprofit group promoting dive community, sharing knowledge and experience. We are a group of central New Jersey recreational divers representing all ages, certifications, diving interests and levels of experience.

Our monthly meetings feature prominent speakers in the sport of diving or the arts of photography and videography. Club meetings are held on the 2nd Tuesday of the month at 7:30 pm at the Spain Inn in Piscataway from April through October. Meetings are held in one of the restaurant's private dining rooms - just ask the wait staff where the scuba divers are meeting. Join us for dinner before the meeting at 6:30 pm. Visitors are welcome!

We organize boat dives, dive vacations and other social events, including a December holiday dinner, a Sunday brunch, a summer picnic and a Delaware River rafting trip.

Need a dive buddy? Join the club!

Visit us on the Web www.explorersdiveclub.org

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses
Group for younger widows/widowers to have support
Social Meeting for Widows and Widowers

results.description:
Soaring Spirits is an organization  run by widowed people, that connects widowed people world wide. Our goal is to give you hope and to let you know that you're not alone. We have Regional Groups all over the US and are starting one here in NYC. It's a social group where we all connect and share. Although our group is open to anyone in the NY/NJ area or anyone who wants to travel for a social event, most of our meet-ups are in Manhattan. Sometimes we meet in other buroughs as well. This is a social hang-out group, not a support group, although we do offer each other plenty of support.  

 We're all inclusive - no matter your age, sex, religion (or lack thereof), sexual preference, relationship status, etc. This is NOT a dating service, it's a place to connect and make friends. We meet 2x per month at local restaurants, parks, beaches, movies, plays, museums, and many other fun events. If you have lost the person you planned on spending the rest of your life with to death, and you'd like to meet other people who "get it", give us a try. Welcome.
results.name: NYC-Area Widows and Widowers Soaring Spirits Group Meetup

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
The Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club has been providing lively discussions of books focused on foreign affairs, international issues, and US economic and political themes for the last 7+ years. Our core group of 12-15 welcomes all those interested in joining the discussion.

We meet monthly (Sept-June) often on the 3rd Tuesday at the Greenwich Library.  (Check the front desk for to see which meeting room we're in).

Our current members have a variety of experiences and a wealth of personal history and perspective to share from past careers and/or travel.  We've had people come for one topic, never to see them again, and others who have been stalwart attendees from Day 1.

We try to find books that are not too long (300 page targeted maximum), that might appeal to a broader audience (so we can justify the Library buying a few copies), and that are on topics that our readers are looking to explore.  

I've listed the books we've reviewed over the last few years on a page in the Pages section so that you can get a feel for our style.

Feel free to join us to just observe the discussion, or dive right in.
results.name: Greenwich Library Foreign Affairs Book Club

Our main goal is to get outdoors and do the following:

Walking, light- hiking, monthly group gatherings, (ideas welcome for that...)
to include Central Park, Riverside, interesting neighborhoods and hopefully some local "field-trips" to parks with good trails. Our walks will be in the hour to 1 -1/2- hour range. Events will be flexible and open ended. No hiking boots required for our terrain.

I started this group because I enjoy walking the city and I would love sharing it. I would like to meet other people who want to get some exercise and enjoy the city and have some fun conversation along the way. We can then have impromptu social time following our walks at local venues. I will plan after-work weeknight walks in addition to weekends.

If you are looking to meet new friends, enjoy the great weather after our long winter and get back in the exercise mode and social scene, then this is your group :)

Please spread the word. The more the better! All are welcome women, men, your friends, (single, married and in between).

Hope to see you soon!

Madeleine

results.description:
We'd like to share experiences building scalable monitoring and alerting solutions using Graphite, Grafana, Collectd, Nagios, Logstash, Elasticsearch and Kibana, among others.

We believe that it is easy to collect metrics from any one system, and to define alerts on single metrics. We already have this capability in place. However, in complex systems, the real operational challenges arise from the way system components interact. Some of these components live inside our data center, some live outside our data center, and all are updating on differing timelines. The functionality and performance of every component has the potential to change every day.

Our challenge is to identify patterns and correlations across multiple systems in our stack. We need to integrate top-down and bottom-up analysis, so we can see, for example, that trial subscription signups (a user metric) fell off at the same time that an internal API call began to fail (an application metric), and it was caused by a database host falling offline (a system metric).

When collecting so much data, there is a risk of being overwhelmed and not being able to make sense of it all. In essence, a risk of collecting data but not producing intelligence. We combat this risk by converting our accumulated data into the most visually information-dense format available: graphs. Then we make graphs easy to compare and easy to share. We make them informative at a glance and easy for the team to keep watching. Finally, once we are regularly identifying patterns across our graphs, we should have an automated way to "watch the graphs" in our absence. It is not an AI or a pattern recognition "black box", it should just automate patterns that humans have first validated to be meaningful.
results.name: Monitoring NYC

results.description:
"Your playing small does not serve the world ... We are all meant to shine."

So when creating this club, I knew I wanted it to be one that empowers and inspires and connects leaders and visionaries in one place. We're mixing a good happy hour, and brunch on a rooftop or other chic venue, with this Amazing Perspective Social Book Club. This club is for new New Yorkers and old New Yorkers looking to transform their perspective on life and the world through inspiring experiences and books. We will read:

• Books you can learn from and apply to your life, and 

• Books that inspire, encourage and challenge you to be your best and do your best: whether that means starting a new business, going back to school, changing careers or being more open to what's around you.

This book club exists to: 

• Read AMAZING books

• Bring together awesome people like you and me & establish genuine connections

• Have good, meaningful conversations about life, our purpose, and our struggles and triumphs while enjoying new experiences and eating at some of the best restaurants in New York City

• Inspire and encourage you  

• Teach you something new and learn more about yourself

• Nourish your soul

Type of book: 

Whether it’s a bio, non-fiction, fiction, or new age, these books will change your life and the way you see the world. It will be reading you can’t put down, that pulls on your heart strings and makes you think about improving your own life, and reading that’s all about personal growth and development. I’ll also take suggestions from our AP Book Socialites, so you’ll have a say as well. 

Here’s how it works: 

• We get 6 weeks to read the book. 

• We meet for Sunday brunch the week we complete the book. Locations will vary throughout Manhattan. During brunch we’ll discuss how the book impacted (or not impacted) your life and how you will incorporate what you’ve learned into your daily practices. 

• We also meet for happy hour and other events throughout the month to break up our work week with some positive, inspiring vibes and good convo. Feel free to suggest venues as well. 

As we explore new parts of ourselves through our reading, let’s explore new restaurants and new parts of the city, and things that bring out the best of us and enrich out lives. The important thing is we live life from an AMAZING Perspective. 

I’m looking forward to connecting, reading and growing with you.

With love, 
Juania
results.name: Amazing Perspective Social Book Club

results.description:
NJ Tech Hardware Startups is a group serving both New Jersey and New York. We look forward to collaborating among entrepreneurs, inventors, Hobbyists, new product development of large companies, engineers, scientists, and others. 

We believe that “…Hardware is the New Software” but is extremely complex and in need of people from almost all market and technology areas. Our hope is to help people accelerate the process, and reduce the risk of moving from Concept to Production and Market. Or, to learn about new ways of designing, prototyping, building and fulfilling tech hardware, software, systems & Components. 

We will be focused on many facets of the Tech Hardware Community including Business (Marketing, Sales, Product Management, Finance, Legal and Operations), Technology, Manufacturing, Positioning, and other facets to bring software integrated hardware systems to market and expansion. 

This is the place to collaborate with and learn from others who are: 

• Considering starting up a Tech Hardware type company, 
• Tinkering around with various technologies to test their ability to solve more problems and increase their effectiveness
 • New to the industry and simply curious about what is possible
 • Trying to figure out how to bring your concept or idea from a concept to a prototype
 • Evaluating manufacturing options for high volume production of your product through either off-Shore or on-Shore or both
 • Assessing the market value and investment options for hardware companies.  

We look to bring to light, discussion, and problem solving of challenges and opportunities of Tech Hardware products and cover the high growth areas of:
• Additive Manufacturing - 3D Printing
• Electronics 
 • Telematics
•  M2M
•  IoT – Internet of Things
 •  Robotics
•  Tech Fashion - including Wearables) 
 •  And what ever you need help with! 

We are bringing all stakeholders in the startup and growth stage business cycle to this group and ensure that companies, looking to manufacture and develop products, are organized for success. You will collaborate with and learn from:
• Angel, VC, Private Equity, and other Investors
• Engineers– all disciplines (i.e. mechanical, software, materials, electrical, textile, etc.)
 • Entrepreneurs
 • Manufacturers and Operations
 • Inventors, Hobbyists, and Tinkerers
 • Marketers
 • Developers
 • Applied and Basic Researchers
 • Professionals and Business Executives
 • Technologists - Software, Hardware and Systems
• Transportation & Logistics.

 Hope to see you soon.
results.name: Manufacturers, Inventors & Tech Hardware Startups

Do you want to enjoy New York City while learning language and culture and making exciting friendships?

I'm Jad Valentín, a NYC tourist guide and linguist who speaks 7 languages. I have a real passion for language, culture, and NYC. I love talking to people of different backgrounds, so I'm looking forward to hearing your story. Why are you in NYC? What are your goals in life? What do you like to do for fun? Let's become friends and enrich each other's lives. This group will have many events centred around language, culture, and NYC. Come on a tour with me for free or hang out in our many events (café meets, restaurant events, parties, movie nights, walking tours, and anything you'd like to recommend). If you're reading this, you belong in the group, and I'm looking forward to being your friend. 

By the way, when you apply, please upload a profile picture with your actual face. It's friendlier to do so. Thanks in advance!
results.name: Big Apple Language & Culture

results.description:
Welcome to SOCCER FOR FUN!  We are a Co-Ed Adult Soccer Club for those who love the game of soccer and are searching for a friendly and exciting atmosphere to enjoy it. Our players' skills range from beginners to more advanced players that enjoy playing more relaxed games than those found in competitive leagues.

Our games will be held primarily at Raymond O'Conner Park 33rd Avenue & Corporal Kennedy St. Bayside NY 11361  or at Alley Pond Sports Center Park located at corner of Union Turnpike and Winchester Blvd, Queens Village (79-20 Winchester Blvd, Queens Village, NY 11427) starting at 9:00 AM sharp! Members should always check the site for any updates on the venue and times. We will host various games from small pug games to big field 11 v. 11 games to exciting tournaments throughout the year.  In addition to our weekly games from time to time we will host other events such as attending professional soccer matches, viewing sporting events at local pubs, annual BBQ and so on.  

Code of Conduct

·  Never be disrespectful to other players or opponents

·  Foul language will be frowned upon and unacceptable

·  Obey the RSVP rules

Rules of Play

·  Slide tackling, high kicks or rough play strictly prohibited

·  Penalties in the box if intentional are taken otherwise kicks are always indirect (except during a tournament)

·  Not all games will have referees so please respect any call made by any player on the field.  All disputes will be settled by your Team Captain.

RSVP Rules

If you sign up and make a team for the game you are expected at the field ready, willing and able to play.  All Members can update their RSVP before teams are posted the night before the game.  If you fail to update timely or to show up at a game you will not be permitted to sign up for the next two weeks.  If you fail to show twice you will not be able to sign up for two months.  This rule is enforced in order to get the players on the field that want to play especially if there is a waiting list.  Any and all emergencies will be taken under consideration and any last minute drops if you notify your organizers we will try to get a replacement player for the game thereby preventing a no show.  Our goal is to have full games each week and getting as many members on the field as possible.

Our Club’s mission is to provide a warm, friendly and safe environment for players to come and enjoy Soccer.
results.name: SOCCER FOR FUN

results.description:
This group is for local history buffs - those who want to learn more about our City - either on foot or through slide show/lecture. There are many organizations that offer walks and talks led by docents and experts - some free, some for nominal cost ($20 or under).  

Posted events are open to the public and run by public organizations and licensed tour guides.  Some require pre-registration.  Read the description of the event carefully.  An RSVP on meetup does not mean you have registered for the event.  You will sometimes need to registered beforehand on an organization website or pay in advance to guarantee a spot.

This meetup differs from other walking meetups in that we will only be attending curated events rather than wandering around exploring or being led by the Meetup organizer.  We will be attending tours and lectures offered by tour guides, historical societies, preservation groups among others.   Some events will be in a bar or cafe or other informal place, but some will be more formal classroom style.  We will be meeting up either AT the event or AFTER the event but NOT BEFORE the event.   

Some events have an organizer - the organizer will attend the event and bring a Meetup sign and look for other group members.  Members can group together during the event (i.e., sit together at a lecture) or socialize afterwards.  The organizer cannot always guarantee that you will have a spot at the event unless you pre-register or pay the sponsor of the event.

Some events will not have an organizer.  Those events are posted to inform members of things that are happening in case anyone would like to attend on their own or with friends.  Anyone can become a co-organizer by messaging the organizer, so if there is an event you would like to share, or you would like others to attend with you, please step up.

All posted events are run by organizations or licensed tour guides.  If there is any payment for the event it is made directly to the organization or the tour guide giving the tour.

Have fun and enjoy the events!

Linda Fisher
results.name: NYC Walks and Talks

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in 3D Printing or seeing awesome things being created. 

Particularly in Brooklyn there's still not enough resources for first time makers so whether you've made prints before or just think the concept sounds awesome, all skill levels are welcome. 

We want everyone to have the chance to get hands on experience using a 3D Printer and one on one training to go from idea to producing a physical object.  

We will also be offering live webinars so those who cannot make our in-person classes can learn as well. 

We'll be teaching how a 3D Printer works, answering questions and guiding folks through the process of creating their first print. No supplies, experience or expertise needed. 

For those looking for more advanced insight into 3D Printing we will have folks available for any specific questions. 

You should join our group if your interested in learning about 3d printing, meeting other 3D Printing users, own a 3d printer and want to get more out of it, or like testing out software and hardware in one of the fastest growing industries.   

If you have any projects, ideas or tricks for 3D Printing you'd like to discuss please share them with the group as well!
results.name: 3D Printing 101 - Learn 3D Printing

results.description:
Time to take care and empower your greatest asset.  You!!

Solopreneurs, you don't have to go it alone.  Life-transitioners, get ideas and support.

We're mixing it up and getting creative here in our studio.  I don't know about you, but I've got enough traditional networking on my calendar.

Here, in the Business Bliss Studio, we're dedicated to growing you so you can grow your business.  We're blending business, fun and retreat so you can master "business bliss."

Think Creative Mastermind + Natural Networking +  Life Support (aka self-care). We're mixing business and retreat to help you access the the 5 keys to success: Clarity. Confidence. Creativity. Community. Mindset.  I'll find the spaces and bring the expertise.  You come to learn, share feedback in our circle, and receive support from me and the other awesome Business Bliss Masters.  

Bring your ideas, let us help you brainstorm.  Bring your biz questions, and let me, and our members help you get answers.  We'll end each session with a mindfulness practice, e.g., meditation, visualization.  This is about heart-centered networking and support.  Creative co-creation rocks!

Networking happens naturally, as you engage in a community of like-hearted entrepreneurs, that speak your language, and have your best interest at heart. 

I believe that growing and sustaining your business shouldn't have to mean burnout.  It's time to slow down to speed up your success so you can know less stress, more creativity, productivity and joy in your life and business.   

Startup entrepreneurs, solopreneurs and conscious business entrepreneurs will really appreciate the support and wisdom we will share.

Join us if you are a mindful entrepreneur that likes to give and receive support from other awesome entrepreneurs, appreciates mindfulness & meditation, and would love getting out of the office on inspirational outings.

P.S. I invite you to join us and complement this with other groups that are 100% dedicated to networking.  Grow you with us to radiate confidence and power and rock the house as you network in other groups.
results.name: Business Bliss - NYC Mindful Mastermind & Natural Networking

results.description:
This is a group about how to live more consciously.

We work with issues you want to talk about (e.g., my relationship is on the skids; I'm miserable in my career; I have anxiety; anything at all) and then see what they look like through the lens of any or all of these ancient, universally spiritual concepts:

Be Compassionate • Beliefs Matter • Be Present • Choices Abound • Everything Is Energy • Have an Attitude of Gratitude • Intentions Matter • Judgments Separate Us • Listen to Inspiration • Mind and Body Are Connected • Take Responsibility • The Law of Attraction Is Always On • We Are All Connected • We Are Here for a Reason • We Belong to the Planet, Not the Planet to Us

So if you generally nod your head in agreement with these concepts and are interested in seeing what happens to your Life when you integrate them more and more into your daily experience, grab an issue, grab a friend, and accept my invitation to come to a drop-in class and learn how to live a bit more consciously.

I come and go from my native New York and am thrilled to share this down-to-earth, dynamic, compelling and thought-provoking practice with you while I'm here. I look forward to meeting you and working out some stuff. :)

P.S.  I have taught Spiritual Workout for Entrepreneurs in San Francisco for much of 2014 and here are what some of those folks have said about this class (and it's the same for entrepreneurs and everyone else):


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOl-bhemoag

results.description:
Weekly Sunday Feast Open House: 

Every Sunday, a simple hall becomes a temple. The love and devotion of the devotees, and the decorated presence of Krishna, positively transform the place. Once the activities begin you are transported to the spiritual world. 

There is an enchanting and purifying arati (worship) and kirtana (devotional song). Everyone participates, singing and dancing hand in hand. The Krishna-Katha (speaking of the Lord) and discussion is absorbing as it is instructive. The Krishna Kids Vedic Sunday School is so popular that many parents ‘have to’ come for the kids’ sake!

Devotees of all ages join together in groups singing for the Lord and playing classical instruments while joyfully dancing to the music. Yet the atmosphere is prayerful and respectful. A delicious pure vegetarian feast of prasadam (sanctified food) is served to one and all – always plenty, always wonderful.

The Center offers a respite from a taxing week at home or work; for many it’s also a fun day for their kids. Join us and see what the Center can offer you! Please join us with your friends and family for our weekly program, and afterwards enjoy a scrumptious pure vegetarian feast.

This event is FREE of charge. All are welcome to attend. We host a variety of events to provide spiritual knowledge and satisfaction for the soul. All are welcome. RSVP is not required to attend any of our events - please simply come and join us!


Sunday Activities (FREE) - Everyone is invited to visit Sunday 4pm - 10pm

•  Sunday School - Cultural training for Children - Gopal class (Ages 5-9) & Madhav class (Ages 10-17)

•  Prasadam - Pure Vegetarian Feast which is offered to the Lord

•  Arati (worship), Kirtan (devotional song), Bhajans (hymns), Satsang (devotee association)

•  Krishna Katha - Bhagavad Gita, Srimad Bhagvatam discources by illustrious speakers

Connect with us:

Website - http://www.iskconnj.com

Facebook Page - https://www.facebook.com/iskconnj

Also offering:

  - Please contact Jayprakash Prabhu @ 646 431-7606 

• Samskara & Yajna Services - Vivah (Wedding), Sehra-Bandi (Pre-wedding), Griha Pravesa (New Dwelling), Krishna ashtotara Nama Havan, Homa (Fire Sacrament), Sraadha Kriya (Yearly Memorial)

                                   Bhakti Vriksha home gatherings help us to “walk the talk”

If you have ever pondered the use of various spiritual truths in day-to-day life, this is for you. We discover how the Bhagavad Gita is actually meant to help us navigate through various complexities of existence on this planet as we march toward higher goals. Our Bhagavad Gita study groups explore practical applications of philosophical and theological principles. We gain a deeper understanding of the scriptures and learn to apply them for spiritual and material success.

These weekly programs begin with kirtan (devotional song) and arati (worship), followed by a lecture on spirituality and a vegetarian dinner. All events are free of charge.

results.description:
Bienvenue au groupe Meetup Le PlayGroup Francophone, 

Le PlayGroup offre des activités aux enfants de 0 à 5 ans accompagnés d'un adulte quatre matins par semaine de 9h30 à 11h proche de Madison Square Park. 

Les enfants se rencontrent et participent à plusieurs activités centrées sur la culture francophone internationale. Tout est fait pour que ce temps passé au sein du PlayGroup permette aux enfants d'être dans un environnement où la langue parlée est le français. 

(Please, note that the purpose of the PlayGroup is not for the children to learn French but rather to spend time in a French speaking environment and to meet other bilingual French speakers) 

Une rencontre typique se déroule de la manière suivante:

• 9h30 - 10h00: Arrivée, jeux libres avec les jouets du PlayGroup.

• 10h00 - 10h30: Activité bricolage.

• 10h30 - 11h00: Goûter.

• 11h00 - 11h30: Histoire et chansons.

Cotisations PlayGroup: Le montant de la cotisation à payer est de $15 par Meetup. 

"Whether you want to preserve your heritage, develop your child's brain, or prepare them for an eventual second language, [Le PlayGroup Francophone in New York City] is ready to help you out. Studies show that even brief, regular exposure to a foreign language at a young age can help your child's ability to pick up languages later in life as well as developing their ability to think abstractly and to focus." (source MommyPoppins) 

Regular activities include: 

- Free play: toys (with a dedicated baby corner), books, puzzles, etc. 

- Crafts for little hands 

- Storytelling in French 

- Movement and music (French songs and rhymes)
results.name: Le PlayGroup Francophone

¡Yoga para todos!

Yoga terapéutica, suave y con énfasis en la respiración, ideal para cualquier nivel. En la clase puedes esperar instrucciones claras, demostraciones y asistencia personalizada, para alcanzar mayor flexibilidad, fuerza, balance, enfoque, y un sentido de tranquilidad con una práctica regular. Si ya tienes tiempo haciendo yoga y quieres profundizar más, o si eres principiante y quieres explorar un poco este terreno, mis clases están abiertas a todos los niveles.

Ven y participa, y luego de tu experiencia entrega tu contribución si la clase fue de tu agrado. Es una clase por donación, así que cualquier gesto que indique tu satisfacción con la experiencia en la clase será muy bien recibida (y así ayudar pagar la tarifa de MeetUp).

Trae tu colchoneta, una botella de agua y una sonrisa, para que comencemos el día a todo dar con yoga en Nueva York.

También hay clases de yoga online. Puedes inscribirte en yogawithsoraya.com.

Espero verte pronto para que compartamos nuestra práctica.

results.description:
Please join the Manhattan Robin Hood Tax on Wall street meetup site for now to be invited to specific local meetups , and local meetup groups as they develop. Bottom line: when someone suffers an Economic Injustice in America we all suffer.

Help us Stop Wall Street Greed hurting ordinary Americans

Time to take back our Government from Wall Street’s control. Tax Wall Street, the 1%, for Human Needs not Wall Street Greed. For a Robin Hood Tax on Wall street - because when someone suffers an Economic Injustice in America we all suffer. Warren Buffet has declared: “Stop Coddling the Super-Rich” and we agree! Please Join Warren and support the Robin Hood sales tax on Wall Street stock and bond trades.

Sign up on Robin’s Facebook Page at: http://www.Facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUSA/
Sign Up on Robin’s Web site at: http://www.RobinHoodTax.org/ The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street can be the game changer for a fairer, more democratic, humane, balanced, and moral American Tax System. The Robin Hood Tax can mean slightly less for the 1% at the top and lots more for the 99% below.

Web Page: http://RobinHoodTax.org/
Please Endorse and Volunteer: https://www.facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUsa/app_1002658966903...
Main FB Page: https://www.facebook.com/RobinHoodTaxUSA
Please follow our twitter page: @RobinHoodTax
New York Pages on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NewYorkCitizensforTheRobinHoodTax..., New York City Citizens for The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street, CUNY Students, Staff, Faculty & Alumni for The Robin Hood Tax on Wall St
As American’s, every day we delay in implementing the Robin Hood Tax the Super Rich have more power and we have fewer options. Acting now is in America’s best interest.


The Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street is the game changer for a fairer, more democratic, humane, balanced, and moral American Tax System

This tiny sales tax on Wall Street is:
.5% on stocks, just $.50 (50 cents) for each $100 of stock trades;
.1% on bonds, just $.10 (ten cents) for each $100 of bond trades;
.005% on derivative speculation in currencies, commodities, or other trades, just $.005 (half a penny) for each $100 of trades

The revenue generated is estimated by economists to be up to 350 billion each year! The Robin Hood Tax can mean slightly less for the 1% at the top and lots more for the 99% below.

Our Current Sales Tax System Does Not Tax the Items That the Top 10% American Households (by Wealth) almost exclusively own.
Things everyone has to buy have a Sales Tax like toilet paper, toothpaste, cars, condo’s and homes. Things only the top 10% of Wealthy Households buy have no sales tax. Sadly that’s True.

Even Worse the top ten percent of American Households have 81% to 94% of stocks, bonds, trust funds, and business equity, and almost 80% of non-home real estate. Since financial wealth is what counts as far as the control of income-producing assets, we can say that just 10% of the people own the United States of America. Sadly this is another clear example of: Those that have the gold get to make the rules.

Organizations representing over 100,000,000 Americans are now involved with the American Robin Hood Tax Campaign. Thousands of endorsers, 100’s of Organization endorsers, over 1,000 economists, the Vatican, Some of the brightest minds in the country and the 4 of the richest men in America, have endorsed the Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street.

Three Benefits of the Robin Hood Tax
Although every Robin Hood Tax has its own specific intended purpose, there are some general intended purposes which are common to most of them. Below are some of those general commonalities. The intended purpose may or may not be achieved.
Curbing volatility of financial markets
In 1936, when Keynes first proposed a financial transaction tax, he wrote, "Speculators may do no harm as bubbles on a steady stream of enterprise. But the situation is serious when enterprise becomes the bubble on a whirlpool of speculation." Rescuing enterprise from becoming "the bubble on a whirlpool of speculation" was also an intended purpose of the Robin Hood Tax and is a common theme in several other types of financial transaction taxes.
More fair and equitable tax collection
Another common theme is the proposed intention to create a system of more fair and equitable tax collection. An Automated Payment Robin Hood tax taxes the broadest possible tax base, namely all transactions including all financial asset transactions. Instead of introducing progressivity through the tax rate structure, the flat rate introduces progressiveness through the tax base since the highest income and wealth groups undertake a disproportionate share of financial transactions.
According to several leading figures, the "fairness" aspect of a financial transaction tax has eclipsed, and/or replaced, "prevention of volatility" as the most important purpose for the tax. Fraser Reilly-King of Halifax Initiative is one such economist: he sees a Robin Hood Tax as important for bringing a more equitable balance to the taxation of all parts of the economy.[23]
Less susceptible to tax evasion than alternatives
According to some economists, a financial transaction tax is less susceptible to tax avoidance and tax evasion than other types of taxes proposed for the financial sector. An Automated Payment Robin Hood Tax employs 21st century technology for automatically assessing and collecting taxes when transactions are settled through the electronic technology of the banking payments system. Stop Blaming the Poor for Wall Streets Greed

Warren Buffett isn’t the only rich guy who wants to higher taxes on the rich, such as The Robin Hood tax which he has specifically endorsed. A survey from Spectrem Group found that 68% of millionaires (those with investments of $1 million or more) support raising taxes on those with $1 million or more in income. Fully 61% of those worth of $5 million or more support increased taxes on million-plus earners.
results.name: Manhattan - Robin Hood Tax on Wall Street Campaign Events

results.description:
New York has a long, rich history of night photography. William Fraser, Alfred Steiglitz, Edward Steichen and other great luminaries walked the same streets we do today, capturing some of the world's most notable low light photographs. 

Join us after the sun goes down to explore what your camera is capable of when you leave the shutter open long enough. We'll re-explore familiar locations to see things in a new light and work with each other to light things in new ways. 

Our goal is to follow the footsteps of the original Camera Club of New York around the turn of the previous century to collaborate and forge a community for the long term that can host group shows and work together to create new works. We plan on Meetups at least every other month and more if there is demand. Come out and spend the night with us.

Here's what you need:

• A camera with manual settings.  Film, digital, whatever, we like them all.

• A tripod (not for every meetup though!)

• A remote for your camera, hopefully an intervalometer that can be programmed)

That's it.  We're not looking only for DSLR people, we've seen amazing stuff come from Micro 4/3 point and shoots, so don't be ashamed of your gear!

results.description:
Many of us aspire to be artistic in one form or the other, but we carry within us hindrances to either doing our work or moving it out into the world (commonly called “marketing”) -- or both. We think we are not good enough, our work is not good enough, will be judged, we lack enough talent or imagination or commitment or time, we can’t trust the future, we need more ambition and drive, and on and on. We cannot get beyond our fears and start doing our artistic work full-out and then putting our work out there for others to experience. We become closeted artists, and if we do manage to express ourselves artistically, we shy away from sharing it with others, with the world — full-out. We fear criticism mostly. Failure. Rejection. We want to be approved of, to be appreciated and recognized. Being appreciated is not bad, but when it becomes more important than our self-expression, it doesn't bring any fulfillment at all. Mainly, we are just too self-critical. There is nothing holding us back but us. When we see this negative pattern with gentle guidance, we can laugh at the illogic of it all and move into doing our creative work with passion and inspiration. The seriousness is gone, so our "work" becomes our "play." We will use The Work of Byron Katie, a powerful but gentle tool for self-investigation, to get at our deep, underlying beliefs that stop us from fulfilling our dreams to write, dance, paint, sculpt, act, play music, make a movie, cook, create a business, do anything that we want to do. Join us and get to work on the beliefs and fears that stop you from being the fully creative person you secretly want to be. For more information about Byron Katie and her work, go to thework.com or read her book Loving What Is. There are plenty of youtube.com videos of Katie doing The Work with others and explaining how The Work works.  Another good addition to this meetup is my meetup "Marketing for Artists and Other Creative People" at http://www.meetup.com/Marketing-for-Artists-and-Other-Creative-People/grow/ 

I hope to see you soon at our meet up!    Ben, Your Organizer
results.name: Unblocking Your Creativity

results.description:
The Institute for Architectural Research is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) collaborative forum, created to foster the purpose of pursuing architectural fundamentals. The Institute’s research focuses on matters of perception, image fabrication, cultural ecology, and spatial relationships between human experiences and societal concerns. The Institute is open to anyone with interest and appreciation of architecture, design, and art, while embracing the urban culture of New York City.

By joining this group, you will become part of the Institute's collaborative architectural community. We will notify Meetup members on architecture social events, lectures, exhibits, and workshops relating to art, design, history and theory. 

Workshops offered by the Institute are for both beginning and advanced designers. Classes include college architecture preparatory courses for high school and college undergraduate students, portfolio design, hand drawing classes, and tutorials on digital design programs. We offer a wide range of opportunities, for all levels of experience, to learn about architectural principles. Our initiative is to link aspiring architects, artists, and designers with experienced professionals in order to promote a unique mode of learning.

Funding for events, in a large part, comes from donations, but in some cases, we may need to charge workshops to provide for materials and time. (100% of every purchase goes into yearly programming in teaching and research at the Institute for Architectural Research, Inc.) However, cost is free for members of the public with low income, this also includes students in middle and high school, or students currently enrolled in a University. Approval of free admissions will be review by the board of directors. If you would like to waive the cost of any workshop, please email admissions@architecturalresearch.org.

The core value of the Institute for Architectural Research is to cultivate a shared educational environment, seeking architectural innovations from all urban cultural backgrounds. The Institute encourages new ideas, concepts, and sharing of research in a diverse multicultural environment in the metropolitan area of New York.

Sincerely,

Scott Aker, AIA, LEED AP BD+C and Michael Sciarrillo, AIA

Founders

Please visit us, the Institute for Architectural Research, Inc. @ www.architecturalresearch.org

topics.name: Your Role in Addressing Climate Change

results.description:
Hi, Climate Rescuers!

First, here's what our meetup is, and is not, about.

1) We are about exploring whether a pioneering new utilization of free market capitalism called Climate Rescue Capitalism can help our world begin to take meaningful action on climate change.

2) We are not about actually selling or marketing any goods or services.

3) We will use as our discussion resource, an 88-page book the owner of this group, George Ortega, published on September 3rd, 2014 titled Climate Rescue Capitalism: Using Product Profit to Fight Climate Change.

Please download your free pdf copy of the book from here -

  http://files.meetup.com/17040262/crc.pdf


Now for the details.

The climate crisis that is upon us looms larger each day. As each year passes, and our world remains incapable of summoning the will to respond meaningfully, the crisis grows more menacing, and the cost of our eventual, inevitable response increases. This cost is measured not in millions, but in billions of dollars that could easily extend into the trillions. But that’s not our primary concern.

Our problem is that in 2014, the Pew Research Center reported that Americans ranked global warming near the bottom of Presidential and Congressional priorities for the years 2009 through 2014, and that only 44 percent of Americans currently believe there is solid evidence the phenomenon exists, and is anthropogenic. We believe that Climate Rescue Capitalism can play an important role in solving this problem.

Climate Rescue Capitalism is an economic tool that empowers our world’s people to fight climate change every time we buy the products we routinely buy. It is a way to use capitalism to directly fight climate change, rather than to further enrich the corporations that are preventing our world from taking responsible action on climate change. In other words, Climate Rescue Capitalism calls on humanity to go into business for the sake and interests of humanity, and market products that compete with, and win against, products marketed by today’s controlling population.

I refer to this market-based means of increasing humanity’s ability to fight climate change as Climate Rescue Capitalism for two reasons. First, because it is a capitalist venture designed expressly to fund the fight against climate change. And second, because it is a free-market capitalist venture in every sense of the word. It requires no government participation, and infringes upon no one’s personal, political or economic freedom. It is nothing more, or less, than the utilization of capitalist marketing principles and practices for the purpose of fighting climate change, rather than to further enrich the individuals and corporations whose stranglehold on our world’s political will to fight climate change is no longer either ecologically sustainable, or morally acceptable.

Will this new vehicle for channeling product profits toward the fight against climate change work? That’s what this meetup group will explore.

I hope you'll join us.

Sincerely,
George
results.name: Climate Rescue Capitalism - A Climate Change Economy

50 Plus-Making New Friends Club

This Club was created for men and women 50 years old and over. Our mission is to make new friends by suggesting  EVENTS  of interest  to all Club Members. We are a group of people with various interest and life experiences. We don't always want someone else to plan  activities for us. That is why  50 Plus-Making New Friends  fills that void.

Club  Organizer will post EVENTS, but it would be so much better if members also participate in making  suggestions.

This Club was created for you.We all have ideas of things we would like to do and places that we would like to visit.Therefore,this Club is waiting for your suggestions.

                                                    EVENTS MUST BE FREE OR LOW COST


All members are encouraged  to suggest an AFFORDABLE  EVENT with  date,location and time. An event  example could be -- a meetup in  Bryant Park for coffee on 8/16/18 @ 2 pm.All you have to do is give a location,date and time.(YOU MUST ATTEND YOUR SUGGESTED EVENT. CLUB ORGANIZER WILL ATTEND  ALL SCHEDULED EVENTS).


Every event  that is suggested will be reviewed by the organizer before it is posted.  All interested members  for an event should RSVP. 


WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN THIS GROUP?

1. You want to make friends.......

2. You have a suggestion for a day out and want others to enjoy it as well.....

3. You would like to be around people your own age ......

4. You're active and still need more things to do ......

5.You like to save money on events.......

6. You like meeting new and interesting people......

7. You are tired of sitting home alone...

8. You're happy and want to spread your joy with others....

9.  You like going out but don't want to do it alone.... 

10.You want to have an active  social life .....

12.You're new to NYC..........


Whatever your reason, if you meet the age requirement, then please join this Club

Due to the cost of organizing this Club, a small  Annual Membership Payment of $6.00 are  required from all members.Payment is required at your  1st event. (Payment once per year).

The yearly fee of $6.00 help pays the monthly fee to Meetup.com, scheduling events, reserving free tickets to events, guaranteeing  attendance  to events etc.

Join Today!

Best Regards 

Laurel

Designing software is generally difficult. Creating software that can be extended and improved upon over time is equally challenging. 

One technique for easing this strain can be found in the use of design patterns. Patterns in Software NYC is a group of IT professionals whose goal is to introduce and discuss the design and architecture of software. 

The focus is on discussing some of the software patterns one might find in enterprise software. Patterns discussed will range from those that affect the design of object oriented programs to those that facilitate great service oriented architectures. 

The group is open to programmers at all stages in their careers. Participants will have the ability to contribute to discussions, adding their own opinions about the merits of particular solutions and approaches.
results.name: Patterns in Software NYC

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in the use of artificial intelligence for creativity, with emphasis in music and visual arts.

Adding a little bit of history to the purpose of this group, I would like to mention my interest in Eurythmics, which was the study of harmony and proportion, by observation of beauty in mathematical ratios, a concept proposed by Pythagoras. 

Eurhythmics could be used to analyze and create all forms of art: music, painting, architecture, etc., and until the middle ages, subjective and objective branches of knowledge such as arithmetic, music, geometry and astronomy (bundled with astrology) thrived together and united as a group known as the Quadrivium.

During that time, knowledge of the Quadrivium was considered a pre-requisite for the study of philosophy, but it fell apart in the Renaissance, when mathematicians became increasingly uninterested in the arts because no theory had successfully provided a link between aesthetics and proportion.

Within the context of data science and artificial intelligence, I hope this group allows participants to discuss and share views to help establish analytical links in the fields or arts, science, and creativity.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/TheQuadrivium/
results.name: Algorithmic Art (Visual & Musical) Composition

topics.name: Work On your Business VS. Working in Your Business

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream.  You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right?  I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more.  Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other in this amazing group.

Matthew Croteau
